Legal_Issue: When does a determination of non-compliance with residency obligations become final under section 28 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 28
Outcome: The application for judicial review was dismissed, and no question was certified for appeal.
Procedural_Context: Judicial review examined whether the deportation order was valid despite a later appeal extension granted by the IAD.
Legal_Provision: Section 28 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Mr. Ikhuiwu's residency was deemed invalid in 2003 due to failure to meet residency obligations.
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Finality occurs when the appeal period expires.
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 28
Review_Outcome: Application dismissed; deportation order remained executable after all legal processes concluded.
Legal_Standard: A person loses permanent resident status upon a 'final determination' made outside Canada that they failed to comply with residency obligations.
Application_Factor: Mr. Ikhuiwu appealed after initial determination but the court ruled the deportation order predated the appeal resolution.
Decision_Outcome: Deportation order upheld as valid and executable.
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the deportation order was invalidated by a subsequent appeal extension.
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 28, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet residency requirements and delay in appealing within prescribed timeframe.
Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in border documents regarding residency compliance
Procedural_Issue: Timeliness of appeal and effect of extension on finality of determination

Legal_Issue: When does a determination of non-compliance with residency obligations become 'final'?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 28
Application_Facts: Applicant missed appeal deadline but later obtained extension from IAD.
Decision_Outcome: Deportation order remains valid and executable after appeal completion.
Court_Ruling: Deportation order valid but suspended pending appeal outcome.
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet residency requirements and overstayed visa
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-finality of residency determination due to appeal extension
Legal_Standard: Final determination occurs when appeal period expires
Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of appeal and validity of extension
Procedural_Issue: Effect of IAD-granted extension on finality of removal order
Application_Basis: Residency obligation not met; appeal filed late with extension granted
Relief_Sought: Suspension or cancellation of deportation order
Governing_Rule: A person loses status upon final determination of non-compliance with residency obligations
Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and did not meet residency requirements
Residency_Compliance: Failed to meet 730-day requirement within five years
Decision_Rationale: Determination becomes final when appeal period expires; extension only suspends removal

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with residency obligation
Violation_Type: Failure to meet physical presence requirement for permanent residents
Legal_Issue: When does a determination of non-compliance with residency obligations become final under section 28 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 28
Application_Facts: Applicant missed appeal deadline but received extension; appeal ongoing at time of review
Decision_Outcome: Application dismissed; no question certified for appeal
Court_Ruling: Deportation order valid but suspended during appeal process
Defendant_Behavior: Did not fulfill 730-day residency requirement within five-year period
Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge based on alleged non-finality of residency determination due to pending appeal
Legal_Standard: Final determination occurs upon expiration of appeal period
Assessment_Factor: Availability and effect of appeal extension under IAD authority
Procedural_Issue: Timing of appeal and impact of procedural extensions on enforceability of removal orders
Application_Basis: Residency obligation not satisfied; appeal rights extended by IAD
Relief_Sought: Stay or cancellation of deportation order
Governing_Rule: Loss of permanent resident status upon final determination of non-compliance
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged deportation based on procedural timing of appeal
Decision_Rationale: Extension suspends removal but does not invalidate finality upon conclusion
Legal_Standard_Applied: Statutory interpretation of 'final determination' and procedural fairness

Crimes.Crime_Name: Committing certain offences leading to deportation
Legal_Issue: When does a determination of non-compliance with residency obligations become final, depriving permanent residents of their status?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s.46(1)(b)
Decision_Outcome: Application dismissed; no question certified for appeal
Legal_Rule: Under s.46(1)(b), a person loses permanent resident status upon a 'final determination' of non-compliance with residency obligations.
Procedural_Issue: Validity of deportation order issued while appeal rights were pending
Grounds_for_Claim: Criminal activity and failure to meet residency obligations
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness arguments raised but rejected
Applicant_Challenge: Argued that determination was not final due to pending appeal
Defendant_Response: Filed appeal after deportation order issued
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Criminal conviction and failure to meet residency obligations
Applicable_Process: Appeal to IAD, followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Final determination occurs when appeal period expires
